dish_name: The Easiest Pizza You'll Ever Make
description: This recipe makes a terrific 'do-it-yourself-party.' All you do is make this simple dough and provide plenty of toppings and grated cheese; your guests will have fun doing the rest.
ingredients: [{"name": "water", "units": "cups", "amount": 2}, {"name": "olive oil", "units": "tablespoons", "amount": 2}, {"name": "table salt", "units": "tablespoon", "amount": 1}, {"name": "granulated sugar", "units": "tablespoon", "amount": 1}, {"name": "active dry yeast", "units": "tablespoon", "amount": 1}, {"name": "King Arthur Unbleached All-Purpose Flour", "units": "cups", "amount": 6}, {"name": "King Arthur Pizza Dough Flavor", "units": "tablespoons", "amount": 2}]
instructions: In a large bowl or the bowl of a stand mixer, combine the lukewarm water, oil, salt, sugar, and yeast. Add the flour and the Pizza Dough Flavor. Mix the ingredients together, adding more water as necessary to make a soft dough. Knead for about 7 to 10 minutes, until it's smooth and elastic. Place the dough in a lightly greased bowl, cover, and let it rise for 1 to 2 hours. Transfer the dough to a lightly greased surface and gently deflate it. Divide it into pieces and roll each piece into a 12" round. Preheat the oven to 450Â°F. Brush each crust with olive oil, spread sauce, and add toppings. Bake for 15 to 20 minutes until golden brown.
notes: To add flexibility to your schedule, let the dough rise once at room temperature, then refrigerate overnight. To freeze partially baked pizza crust, bake until set and cool before freezing.
